alert.note: Alert for Clark; Crawford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 10:42AM CST until February 05 at 6:32PM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River from Lafayette to Vincennes. .Lowland flooding continues along the Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton, and will arrive at Vincennes Tuesday night. The crest is currently at Covington. Flooding is expected to continue along the lower Wabash at Riverton and Vincennes well into next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY, FEBRUARY 05... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Terre Haute. * WHEN...Until Monday, February 05. * IMPACTS...At 22.5 feet, Access to North Lake and Izaak Walton Areas nearly impossible by land vehicles. South Lake Area and 10 homes near Fort Harrison Country Club begin to flood. Water is at critical stage for a few agricultural levees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Monday /9:30 AM CST Monday/ the stage was 20.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EST Monday /9:30 AM CST Monday/ was 20.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.3 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday, February 05. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 245 AM EST /145 AM CST/.
